title:
Impact-parameter-dependent solutions to the Balitsky-Kovchegov equation
  at next-to-leading order
authors: J. Cepila, J. G. Contreras, M. Matas, M. Vaculciak
abstract:
A stable numerical solution of the impact-parameter-dependent next-to-leading
order Balitsky-Kovchegov equation is presented for the first time. The rapidity
evolution of the dipole amplitude is discussed in detail. Dipole amplitude
properties, such as the evolution speed or anomalous dimension behaviour, are
studied as a function of the impact parameter and the dipole size and compared
to solutions of the impact-parameter-dependent leading-order Balitsky-Kovchegov
equation with the collinearly improved kernel. The next-to-leading evolution
also strongly suppresses the Coulomb tails compared to the collinearly improved
and leading order solutions.
